line.comment: * SCRIPT NAME: Renegades.Monitor
* DESCRIPTION: Performs any slow running activities that need to be periodically performed.
* AUTHOR: Mr Mordan
* DATE: 21 February 2024
* Wait for starting options to be answered.
* Also wait for full generation of the galaxy.
* Add-Ons 1.2: Replaced difficulty getter with script call.
* 1 Minute timer loop
* 5 Minute timer loop.
* Add-Ons 1.4: Commented out triplex removal.
* gosub CheckForTriplex:
* 30 Minute timer loop
* set in z.cheat.cycrow.menu.xml, this is the player control to enable/disable autosave.
* save here
* Mordan4.
* Occastionally, player ships would end up with a bad relation set against neutral traders because you ordered them to attack one and from there on,
* those attacking ships would continue to attack neutral traders because they are set to attack-all-enemies. This avalanch is undesired.
* While I think this relations issue has been fixed in ship.signal.killed.xml, I put a safety check here to make sure none of our ships consider
* Neutral traders to be hostile and automatically attack as enemies.
* Every 20 minutes, possible spawn of a random Renegade. Scales based on player power and difficulty level of game.
* Late game, any new loaners will head straight for the player.
* If we were unable to acquire an unknown Enclave system at game startup, just return. Don't spawn anything.
* Player has set the global disable flag for renegades. No more loaners.
* plot has ended or station was never created.
* temporary. for debugging
* $playerPower = 5000
* Start raids once the player reaches a certain power level, but taper off later. Note, the average M2 destroyer is worth about 500 power points.
* MordanC - delayed entry of renegades plot.
* Add-Ons 1.2: Renegades are meant to be harassment ships. Having the power too high would make sense on easy and normal, but on hard and insane, the minimum power should be reduced.
* Renegade min and max counts are now scaled based on difficulty.
* Initially allow up to X Renegades to spawn. Once the player power reaches a certain point, we cut that back to 1 (2 on hard, 3 on insane) raider, but that one actively
* seeks and attacks in the player sectors.
* Is player power enough? Note, if player falls below threshold, no new renegades will spawn.
* current list of Renegades in universe
* Are we at the maximum number of renegades?
* find a sector to spawn in.
* Could not find a valid non-player sector to spawn in. Just return.
* ** DEBUG **
* $sowner = $RenegadeSpawnSector-> get owner race
* write to log file 1 append=[TRUE] printf: fmt='Spawning Renegade in: %s. Owned by: %s and Within 10 jumps of: %s', $RenegadeSpawnSector, $sowner, $StartSector, null, null
* ** END DEBUG **
* Spawn a new renegade. Alternate ship types with the faster one being rarer to spawn.
* Spawn an M6 on hard difficulty and an M3 on other difficulty levels.
* Add-Ons 1.2: Pulls from a larger ship list.
* Tell the player when the first renegade apears.

line.text: 'ВНИМАНИЕ! Первый Ренегат отстыковался, патрулирует отдалённый сектор и жаждет крови. Будьте начеку и защищайте свои уязвимые корабли. Удачи, Пилот!'

line.comment: * Start the ship task. If we're late game, set $Seekoutplayer to [TRUE] so that the ship will immediately head for the player to harass them.
* display subtitle text: text='Finding Renegade Player Sector' duration=3000 ms
* find a random player owned sector
* write to logfile 1 append=[TRUE] printf: fmt='Random Player Sector: %s', $StartSector, null, null, null, null
* no player sectors found.
* display subtitle text: text='Could not find any player sectors for a Renegade test.' duration=8000 ms
* Build a list of player ship locations
* Now get a random sector within 10 jumps of the player sector above, that are not owned by player or pirates etc.. and do not have a player ship it.
* Herobetty: if the player joined the OCV, then Xenon sectors are eligible. OCV sectors never exist, but they won't be exempt just in case.
* Does it have a Player ship in it?
* $t = 'Found valid sector: ' + $secinrange
* display subtitle text: text=$t duration=8000 ms
* write to logfile 1 append=[TRUE] printf: fmt='No valid sector found. Sectors within range of %s: \n%s', $StartSector, $sectorswithinrange, null, null, null
* Mordan3 Updates all Hauler's to show a display to the right of their name indicating the level of cargo they are carrying in percent. [] to [.........]
* build new []
* For the last bar, we don't look for an exact 100% full, but rather if it's within 3% of being full. Not everything fits exactly to fill up a cargo hold and it is still basically full.
* TODO: I can remove this segment below for version 2.7
* strip off any [...] that might be in the name from previous failure.
* check ship name to see if the pattern is already there and if so, modify it.
* write to logfile 1 append=[TRUE] printf: fmt='VolMax = %s, VolFree = %s, TenPercent = %s', $volMax, $volFree, $tenpercentvol, null, null
* Everything lines up.. We have [123456789X] in a name, so we work with it.
* Pattern wasn't there, so append the indicator.
* Mordan3 - Checks and updates total number of player owned beacons. We now restrict how many they can own, but there are too many places in the code
* where beacons can be killed, captured, and whatnot, to absolutely determine the player hasn't found a way around this restriction. Also, just the act of droppoing
* a beacon (eject ware) from a ship doesn't appear to have any intercept point in the code that I can find, so we need to peridocally update our count.
* are any beacons in systems the player doesn't own. If so, revert ownership to Neutral. If a player beacon is found in a Phanon sector, it is given to the Phanon.
* Add-Ons 1.4.6: Why remove beacons from unknown space? These are neutral - keep beacons there. However, remove them if placed in the renegade sector and the plot is not yet completed.
* Mordan8 - only convert player beacons to Phanon if we're not yet done with the Close Bonds mission. (See PhanonJumpBeaconConnected.xml)
* Hard difficulty, we won't allow player beacons in systems they don't own unless the player has X Notoriety or better with them.
* Mordan4. Rather than revert ownership and lose it entirely, we can just put it in the nearest outpost.
* Patch. Also, now allowing you to have beacon in Friendly territory, provided your notoriety with them is at least 3333 (level 6). (Add-Ons 1.3) On insane, 10000 notoriety (rank 7) is required.
* see https://x3.solasistim.net/index.php/Reputation/ for list of notoriety rankings and values.
* write to logfile 1 append=[TRUE] printf: fmt='Beacon found, sector owner = %s, notoriety = %s', $sectorowner, $not, null, null, null
* Add-Ons 1.3: Must have +7 reputation rank to keep beacon in NPC space.
* Mordan9 - Get nearest outpost
* $outposts = [NULL]-> call script 'Joubarbe.Lib.GetNearestStations' : stationType={Player Outpost} refObject=$beacon race=null
* if $outposts
* add a new beacon to the outpost
* $outposts = [NULL]-> call script 'Joubarbe.Lib.SortByDistance' : refObject=$beacon array=$outposts
* $outposts = reverse array $outposts
* $outpost = $outposts[0]
* destroy the beacon

line.text: 'Недостаточный уровень репутации у владельца сектора. Требуется уровень '

line.comment: * end
* There really is nothing to prevent the player from dropping beacons all over the place. There's no intercept point in the code. All we can do
* is passively poll how many they put down and delete extras.

line.text: 'У вас слишком много прыжковых маяков. Один уничтожен рандомно. Осталось: '

line.comment: * Any player ship smaller than M1/M2 class can not have a Triplex. Should a player transfer one to a ship, this will periodically go remove it.
* get built in components and see if there's a triplex scanner. If so, remove it.
* = $ship-> add -1 units of {Triplex Scanner}

sval.val: Автосохранение в слот:
ВНИМАНИЕ! Первый Ренегат отстыковался, патрулирует отдалённый сектор и жаждет крови. Будьте начеку и защищайте свои уязвимые корабли. Удачи, Пилот!
Недостаточный уровень репутации у владельца сектора. Требуется уровень
. Ваш маяк в секторе
был перемещен на ваш форпост
У вас слишком много прыжковых маяков. Один уничтожен рандомно. Осталось:
, Макс. маяков:
SCRIPT NAME: Renegades.Monitor
DESCRIPTION: Performs any slow running activities that need to be periodically performed.
AUTHOR: Mr Mordan
DATE: 21 February 2024
Wait for starting options to be answered.
Also wait for full generation of the galaxy.
Add-Ons 1.2: Replaced difficulty getter with script call.
1 Minute timer loop
5 Minute timer loop.
Add-Ons 1.4: Commented out triplex removal.
gosub CheckForTriplex:
30 Minute timer loop
set in z.cheat.cycrow.menu.xml, this is the player control to enable/disable autosave.
save here
Occastionally, player ships would end up with a bad relation set against neutral traders because you ordered them to attack one and from there on,
those attacking ships would continue to attack neutral traders because they are set to attack-all-enemies. This avalanch is undesired.
While I think this relations issue has been fixed in ship.signal.killed.xml, I put a safety check here to make sure none of our ships consider
Neutral traders to be hostile and automatically attack as enemies.
Every 20 minutes, possible spawn of a random Renegade. Scales based on player power and difficulty level of game.
Late game, any new loaners will head straight for the player.
If we were unable to acquire an unknown Enclave system at game startup, just return. Don't spawn anything.
Player has set the global disable flag for renegades. No more loaners.
plot has ended or station was never created.
temporary. for debugging
$playerPower = 5000
Start raids once the player reaches a certain power level, but taper off later. Note, the average M2 destroyer is worth about 500 power points.
MordanC - delayed entry of renegades plot.
Add-Ons 1.2: Renegades are meant to be harassment ships. Having the power too high would make sense on easy and normal, but on hard and insane, the minimum power should be reduced.
Renegade min and max counts are now scaled based on difficulty.
Initially allow up to X Renegades to spawn. Once the player power reaches a certain point, we cut that back to 1 (2 on hard, 3 on insane) raider, but that one actively
seeks and attacks in the player sectors.
Is player power enough? Note, if player falls below threshold, no new renegades will spawn.
current list of Renegades in universe
Are we at the maximum number of renegades?
find a sector to spawn in.
Could not find a valid non-player sector to spawn in. Just return.
** DEBUG **
$sowner = $RenegadeSpawnSector-> get owner race
write to log file 1 append=[TRUE] printf: fmt='Spawning Renegade in: %s. Owned by: %s and Within 10 jumps of: %s', $RenegadeSpawnSector, $sowner, $StartSector, null, null
** END DEBUG **
Spawn a new renegade. Alternate ship types with the faster one being rarer to spawn.
Spawn an M6 on hard difficulty and an M3 on other difficulty levels.
Add-Ons 1.2: Pulls from a larger ship list.
Tell the player when the first renegade apears.
Start the ship task. If we're late game, set $Seekoutplayer to [TRUE] so that the ship will immediately head for the player to harass them.
display subtitle text: text='Finding Renegade Player Sector' duration=3000 ms
find a random player owned sector
write to logfile 1 append=[TRUE] printf: fmt='Random Player Sector: %s', $StartSector, null, null, null, null
no player sectors found.
display subtitle text: text='Could not find any player sectors for a Renegade test.' duration=8000 ms
Build a list of player ship locations
Now get a random sector within 10 jumps of the player sector above, that are not owned by player or pirates etc.. and do not have a player ship it.
Herobetty: if the player joined the OCV, then Xenon sectors are eligible. OCV sectors never exist, but they won't be exempt just in case.
Does it have a Player ship in it?
$t = 'Found valid sector: ' + $secinrange
display subtitle text: text=$t duration=8000 ms
write to logfile 1 append=[TRUE] printf: fmt='No valid sector found. Sectors within range of %s: \n%s', $StartSector, $sectorswithinrange, null, null, null
Mordan3 Updates all Hauler's to show a display to the right of their name indicating the level of cargo they are carrying in percent. [] to [.........]
build new []
For the last bar, we don't look for an exact 100% full, but rather if it's within 3% of being full. Not everything fits exactly to fill up a cargo hold and it is still basically full.
TODO: I can remove this segment below for version 2.7
strip off any [...] that might be in the name from previous failure.
check ship name to see if the pattern is already there and if so, modify it.
write to logfile 1 append=[TRUE] printf: fmt='VolMax = %s, VolFree = %s, TenPercent = %s', $volMax, $volFree, $tenpercentvol, null, null
Everything lines up.. We have [123456789X] in a name, so we work with it.
Pattern wasn't there, so append the indicator.
Mordan3 - Checks and updates total number of player owned beacons. We now restrict how many they can own, but there are too many places in the code
where beacons can be killed, captured, and whatnot, to absolutely determine the player hasn't found a way around this restriction. Also, just the act of droppoing
a beacon (eject ware) from a ship doesn't appear to have any intercept point in the code that I can find, so we need to peridocally update our count.
are any beacons in systems the player doesn't own. If so, revert ownership to Neutral. If a player beacon is found in a Phanon sector, it is given to the Phanon.
Add-Ons 1.4.6: Why remove beacons from unknown space? These are neutral - keep beacons there. However, remove them if placed in the renegade sector and the plot is not yet completed.
Mordan8 - only convert player beacons to Phanon if we're not yet done with the Close Bonds mission. (See PhanonJumpBeaconConnected.xml)
Hard difficulty, we won't allow player beacons in systems they don't own unless the player has X Notoriety or better with them.
Mordan4. Rather than revert ownership and lose it entirely, we can just put it in the nearest outpost.
Patch. Also, now allowing you to have beacon in Friendly territory, provided your notoriety with them is at least 3333 (level 6). (Add-Ons 1.3) On insane, 10000 notoriety (rank 7) is required.
see https://x3.solasistim.net/index.php/Reputation/ for list of notoriety rankings and values.
write to logfile 1 append=[TRUE] printf: fmt='Beacon found, sector owner = %s, notoriety = %s', $sectorowner, $not, null, null, null
Add-Ons 1.3: Must have +7 reputation rank to keep beacon in NPC space.
Mordan9 - Get nearest outpost
$outposts = [NULL]-> call script 'Joubarbe.Lib.GetNearestStations' : stationType={Player Outpost} refObject=$beacon race=null
if $outposts
add a new beacon to the outpost
$outposts = [NULL]-> call script 'Joubarbe.Lib.SortByDistance' : refObject=$beacon array=$outposts
$outposts = reverse array $outposts
$outpost = $outposts[0]
destroy the beacon
There really is nothing to prevent the player from dropping beacons all over the place. There's no intercept point in the code. All we can do
is passively poll how many they put down and delete extras.
Any player ship smaller than M1/M2 class can not have a Triplex. Should a player transfer one to a ship, this will periodically go remove it.
get built in components and see if there's a triplex scanner. If so, remove it.
= $ship-> add -1 units of {Triplex Scanner}
